address: Xã Đức Bình, Huyện Tánh Linh, Tỉnh Bình Thuận
thought:
**My Analysis of the Administrative Unit Change for "Xã Đức Bình, Huyện Tánh Linh, Tỉnh Bình Thuận"**

Okay, so I'm tasked with figuring out what happened to "Xã Đức Bình" after some province restructuring. First, I know the old ward was in Bình Thuận province. Then there was a merger - that was easy, Bình Thuận is now part of Lâm Đồng.

I started by looking for any resolutions mentioning "Xã Đức Bình." There was a resolution mentioning "Đức Bình" in Đắk Lắk province, but that was a no-go since Bình Thuận became part of Lâm Đồng. I focused on resolutions pertaining to Lâm Đồng. And boom! Resolution 1671/NQ-UBTVQH15 for Lâm Đồng explicitly mentions "Xã Đức Bình."

Line 70 of that resolution: it says they're merging several xã, including "Đức Bình," into a new one called "Đồng Kho." That's a direct hit! Now, the new ward data confirms "Xã Đồng Kho" (ward_code 23173) exists in Lâm Đồng. That, paired with the resolution, makes it a very confident match.

The other resolution mentioning "Đức Bình" was a bit of a distraction, and the details don't match up with the province merger scenario. It was relevant but could be discarded as it was for Đắk Lắk.
The new ward list also has a code for a ward called "Đức Bình" in Đắk Lắk, but it doesn't align with the geographical changes, so that was ruled out.

I did a final check, making sure I haven't missed anything. The original ward was in Tánh Linh, the details on the resolution, and merging of areas further solidify the connection. No competing options have strong ties. That leaves me with a JSON output with high confidence, with the information on that new merged ward, a new ward code, and the correct citation with the resolution and line.

citation.header: 1671/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Lâm Đồng
citation.line: 70. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Huy Khiêm, La Ngâu, Đức Bình và Đồng Kho thành xã mới có tên gọi là **xã Đồng Kho**.
